item.title: What To Do With Remembrance of Putrescence In Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree
item.description:
The Putrescent Knight is a glass cannon boss in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree . Though he is an optional boss, players need to defeat him to reach St. Trina and complete the quest of Thiollier. The Knight is very weak to Holy damage, making the fight a breeze with the right build.

Once killed, the Putrescent Knight drops an item called Remembrance of Putrescence . This item can be used to obtain either the Putrescence Cleaver , a Greataxe that deals frost damage, or Vortex of Putrescence , a powerful sorcery that deals AoE damage.

How to Use Remembrance of Putrescence in Shadow of the Erdtree

Players can use the Remembrance of the Putrescence at the Roundtable in the Lands Between. Fast travel there, and go to Finger Reader Enia. She can be found hunched over on a bench in the first room to your right when you teleport to the Roundtable.

Talk to her, and select the option to "Receive power from remembrance," and select Remembrance of Putrescence. Choose either the Putrescence Cleaver or Vortex of Putrescence according to your specific build and needs.

If players want to get both items from the remembrance, they can duplicate their remembrances at Walking Mausoleums spread across the world.

Putrescence Cleaver​​​​​​

Weapon wielded by the Putrescent Knight. A great cleaver of hardened putrescence affixed to an arch fashioned from human bones. Gains power from the wielder's arcane attribute.

The Putrescence Cleaver is a Greataxe type weapon in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree . It weights 13.5, and deals 141 Physical, and 42 Magic damage. Additionally, it causes a 55 Frost buildup in enemies that it hits as well.

Its Ash of War, Spinning Guillotine , takes up nine FP , and can be followed up with another attack for six FP . The player jumps up, and slams down into the ground, and starts to spin forward with the follow-up attack. This skill can go on indefinitely until the player stops or their Stamina/FP runs out.

Putrescence Cleaver Stat Requirements

Putrescence Cleaver Damage & Scaling

Vortex of Putrescence

Sorcery used by the Putrescent Knight.

Launches a whirl of putrescent jets that explode shortly after impact and bathe the area in ghostflame.

In an age long past, Death was burned by ghostflame. Even the remains of tainted flesh were given equal treatment in death.

Vortex of Putrescence is a Death Sorcery that costs 29 FP and takes up two Memory slots . The spell can be charged , and deals Magic damage , although it does build up Frost as well. The spell fires out a ring of flame that shrinks inward towards the player. However, the size of the said ring isn't that big, and the rate of casting is fairly slow, making it impractical most of the time. The only saving grace of the spell is that it can be cast while riding Torrent.

Vortex of Putrescence Stat Requirements

item.title: Where To Get Cerulean Amber Medallion +3 In Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Get Cerulean Amber Medallion +3 In Shadow Of The Erdtree
  • How Good Is The Cerulean Amber Medallion +3

Talismans offer various passive boosts to players, with the only drawback being picking which one is best to equip for your build in Elden Ring: Shadow Of The Erdtree . The DLC adds many upgraded versions of existing Talismans to help further boost players' stats to meet the challenges ahead throughout the Realm Of Shadow.

One powerful Talisman players can find in Shadow Of The Erdtree is the Cerulean Amber Medallion +3, which offers a huge boost in FP. FP is required to cast spells and use skills from weapons or ashes of war, making it a valuable resource every player needs more of. While this Talisman is found in a faraway location, players can travel there fairly early into the DLC without issue.

Where To Get Cerulean Amber Medallion +3 In Shadow Of The Erdtree

The Cerulean Amber Medallion +3 is found by defeating the Death Knight boss at the end of the Scorpion River Catacombs . Despite the Catacombs being located in the northwestern section of the map, players can get here much sooner without traversing the Shadow Keep. From the Ancient Ruins Base Site of Grace, players can travel southwest to find a river to follow north. The river will wrap around the mountain above and lead players straight to the entrance to the Scorpion River Catacombs.

The Scorpion River Catacombs does have a few winding paths but all of them ultimately lead to the Death Knight boss at the end. This boss deals high physical and lightning damage , and it is recommended players bring a Boltdrake Talisman to help negate some of the damage. After defeating the Death Knight, players will be rewarded with the Cerulean Amber Medallion +3 and will now be able to fast-travel out of the dungeon at any point should they ever return.

How Good Is The Cerulean Amber Medallion +3

  • Weighs - 0.3

The boost in FP from this Medallion is a percentage , so those with a higher Mind stat will see a better boost from using this Talisman. Spell-focused builds should consider using this Talisman, as Mind can be a lower-priority stat to upgrade even for those who use a lot of FP. The benefits from this Talisman can be achieved by leveling up a stat, which isn't a common occurrence with most Talisman. Overall this Talisman is great for PVP builds that don't want to cross a specific level threshold, but does fall behind with players who continue to level up without a worry about their max level.

item.title: How Do Alignments Work in Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance?
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Do Choices Matter In Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance
  • How Does Alignment Affect The Canon Of Vengeance
  • How To Check Alignment In Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance

Alignment has been a major part of the Shin Megami Tensei series that continues with Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance . Throughout the story, players will be presented with various options that give a hidden point value to either Law or Chaos.

While there is no direct way to check your alignment score, players are able to check to see what path they are currently taking. Depending on the Canon route players choose, this will also affect how Alignment affects the ending of the game.

Do Choices Matter In Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance


No matter which canon route players choose, major decisions will affect the player's alignment, but these decisions won't impact most of the game . These choices are clearly indicated when the answers appear foggy over the moment on the screen instead of in the text box. For both routes, choices and Alignment won't make you miss any content or get secret content, and will only play a part at the end of the game.

For players that choose Canon of Creation, Alignment won't decide which ending players get , as players will get to choose which ending they get. Depending on your alignment, the bonus miracle will be available at a lower glory price if you pursue the ending for the Alignment you follow. Should players pick an equal number of Law and Chaos options, their Alignment will be neutral.

How Does Alignment Affect The Canon Of Vengeance


The Canon of Vengeance operates a lot like older Shin Megami Tensei games, with the players' alignment deciding which ending they get . The ending players will get won't be set in stone until the final dungeon of the game, meaning they can switch alignments throughout the game until they land on the one they want. There are a limited number of decisions in the game that affect alignment, but more than enough to change your path halfway through the game if desired. In the Canon of Vengeance, Yoko is the Chaos representative with Tao being the Law representative , and choosing dialogue that agrees with their ideals will give points in their respective alignment.

How To Check Alignment In Shin Megami Tensei 5: Vengeance


There is no clear-cut way to see your alignment except when exploring the city of Tokyo. If the blue icon is spinning clockwise, that indicates you're currently Law aligned, counterclockwise indicating Chaos , and not spinning at all means Neutral. There is no Neutral ending for the Canon of Vengeance, and the ending players get will be determined by which side has more points when the ending happens. Without the icon spinning, this means players aren't able to know for sure which ending they are going to get unless they keep track of all decisions made and figure it out themselves.

item.title: How to Get Serpent Flail in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Get Serpent Flail In Elden Ring
  • Serpent Flail Overview & Requirements

Flails are unique weapons in Elden Ring , often overlooked in favor of more popular options like Greatswords and Halberds. Perhaps this is why the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC only added one Flail weapon to the game.

The Serpent Flail may not be a game-changer in your playthrough, but it is still worth considering for its unique skill. It is also essential if you aim to complete your Flail weapon collection. Acquiring it is not a demanding task, as all you need to do is a bit of parkour. The guide below provides an overview of the weapon and its exact location.

Where To Get Serpent Flail In Elden Ring

To acquire the Serpent Flail, follow these steps:

  1. Fast travel to the Scadu Altus, West Site of Grace. This is located west of the Highroad Cross Site of Grace and north of the Fog Rift Fort.
  2. Upon arrival, look to your left, where you should see a fort below. You need to get down there.
  3. Jump to the rocks below, which should be to your right, near the abandoned campfire.
  4. Continue descending until you reach the top of one of the fort's towers.
  5. Descend the ladder, but instead of moving forward, look to your hard left and drop down onto the tarps below.
  6. You should see a chest near some red barrels. Open it to loot the Serpent Flail weapon.

Serpent Flail Overview & Requirements

Attributes Required

Level

Strength

10

Dexterity

24

Faith

21

A flail with coiled snakes for bludgeoning heads. Fire roars within the snakes' bodies, inflicting horrible burns. Some of Messmer's army used these flails to burn hornsent—to brand them with agony and fear.

The Serpent Flail primarily scales with Dexterity and Faith, making it a good option for players who prefer Faith builds. Its Ash of War, however, will only scale with Faith. The flail comes with a unique weapon skill called "Flare, O Serpent," which creates a fire that enhances flame attacks and causes an explosion whenever any attack hits the ground.

This skill can't be charged for extra damage or a bigger explosion. However, the Serpent Flail can be upgraded to +10 using Somber Smithing Stones.

item.title: Elden Ring - Shadow Of The Erdtree: How to Get Swollen Grapes and What They're For
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where To Find Swollen Grape In Shadow Of The Erdtree
  • What To Do With Swollen Grape In Shadow Of The Erdtree

Elden Ring ’s Shadow of the Erdtree DLC expands the repertoire of available tools, giving you the ability to overcome the challenges of the shadow realm in all possible ways. These methods could involve finding new weapons, spells, or even gathering rare resources to craft powerful items.

New to the Shadow of the Erdtree expansion is the Swollen Grape ingredient, which is among the rarest ingredients you can find in the DLC. This following guide will help you acquire this ingredient and provide details on its uses.

Where To Find Swollen Grape In Shadow Of The Erdtree

The Swollen Grapes are rare crafting items that are dropped upon killing the Aging Untouchables patrolling the Abyssal Woods. You can reach the Abyssal Woods by using the secret teleportation coffin below the Shadow Keep. It’s important to consider that, unlike other enemies, the Aging Untouchables cannot be harmed unless you first parry their grab attack .

You can parry their grab using any small shield or dagger infused with the Ash of War: Parry . If you find parrying difficult with the regular Parry Ash of War, you can try using the Ash of War: Golden Parry or Ash of War: Carian Retaliation . You must parry the Aging Untouchable when they raise their right arm over their heads . Successfully killing one of these Untouchables will reward you with some runes and a Swollen Grape.

One of the Aging Untouchables in the game also rewards you with the Aged One's Exultation talisman, which increases your attack power when madness is inflicted in your vicinity .

What To Do With Swollen Grape In Shadow Of The Erdtree

An eyeball of the frenzied flame that has swollen from within. Material used for crafting items. Exceedingly rare to find. Marked with fingerprint burns, proof of having being touched directly by the Three Fingers' embrace.

The game considers Swollen Grape as an exceedingly rare item. These grapes can be used to craft a new consumable called Surging Frenzied Flame .

However, before you can craft the Surging Frenzied Flame, you’ll need to find the following items:

  • Mad Craftsman's Cookbook [3] [3]
  • Spiritgrave Stone x1
  • Swollen Grape x1

The Surging Frenzied Flame is akin to the Frenzyflame Stone that you can throw on the ground or at an enemy. When dropped, the Surging Frenzied Flame then releases eight bursts of Frenzied Flame in all directions, damaging any enemy that comes in contact with . It’s worth noting that the Frenzied bursts do not track the enemies. Using the Surging Frenzied Flame consumes 13FP.
